page.title: 04THE CIDER FARM
page.content: The Langdons cider farm gets its apples from Hereford. They come in 20 ton loads and are dumped in the yard. A tractor with a bucket picks up the apples which are put on an elevator. At the same time they are washed, then they fall into a mincer where every thing is minced. Then you take a slat with a nylon cloth over it and take off a measured amount. We do the same until we have 15 slats on top of each other. Then a ram comes up and pushes it to the top and all the juice runs into a tank below the floor. Next it is put into a tank outside and left for three months. Finally it is sold to the customers who come to the cider farm. We tasted it and it was lovely.
